pros: Always good in communication with employees

cons: My experience was the worse i've had in my life. Discriminatory behavior from partners and managers. They truly look after their own - if you work in Luxembourg, and specifically in big 4, you will know exactly what i mean. It is no secret, that they only pull in international people to fill the quota, but then do not give you the same opportunities to progress. if you manage to become best friends with the partner, you won't have to worry about progression or promotion - it will come regardless of your quality of work. However, even if you do everything right, it only takes 1 manager with a good relationship with the partner to trash your name and make them dislike you for the pettiest of reasons.

date_and_job: Jan 24, 2021 - Manager, Risk Advisory in Luxembourg
pros:
I started at Deloitte Luxembourg as an analyst and was promoted until manager within 5 years. Overall, I had a great time here - I made the experience, that management cares about staff, you are asked for your preferences and you are motivated to develop yourself and grow. I could make experiences working on different types of clients - from small engagements serving companies consisting of 2 employees, to big group audits in different industries with financial services being the main industry. Also I had the chance to work on different types of engagements - audit, regulatory, consulting and travel to other countries. 
In Risk Advisory a big focus is made on educating staff, there are several trainings offered per year and also I could gain several certifications. 
For me, this was a very good team to start my career. I was also quite happy with how management was dealing with the Covid crisis, we were sent to home office early on, and I could feel that management is caring about their people - even if in the beginning there was a lot of uncertainty.

cons:
- Poor work/life balance
- Organization can be difficult to navigate at the beginning
- Administrative burdens that could be improved (e.g Staffing plan, expenses, benefits subscription, cars contract,..)
pros:
- Career Accelerator due to fast increasing responsibilities (management, recruitment, business dev, marketing,..)
- Work and learn with great professionals
- Access to a large set of trainings and certifications
- Competitive package

cons: Linear structure. Not agile or innovative enough.

post_title: Great for professional developement, a bit worse for work and life balance
pros: Working in Deloitte, you are surrounded with real professionals you will always admire and be able to learn form. You will work on exciting projects, you will face challenges every day, you will learn to work fast and efficiently. The company is also like a big family - they organize plenty of team buildings, social, cultural and charity events, sports groups, you will be therefore able to do extra professional activities with your colleagues, which will certainly strengthen the relationships.

cons:
You have to get that knowledge yourself though self study and asking as many questions as you can to seniors as everyone is too busy to actively spend time with you on training
No investments in external education/really hard to get
Poor culture, hard to build honest relations, team spirit nonexistent
